review: The food is great, the service could be a little better, but I am pretty low maintenance so I don't need my water refilled every few minutes. I have noticed recently that the amount of fries they are giving out with the burger has decreased quite a bit, but you can always order more.  It is a great place to bring kids, and the kids menu is pretty cheap.  It is a great place to drop $20-$25 on a night out.

I have been to this place a lot, but when I came back with my dietary restriction, i wasn't too pleased. I tried to sub out my fries for onion rings and the waiter was not too helpful, and in the end I still got fries.  It's not like I am allergic to potatos, but those fries only went to waste.  I could have got a salad instead, but I don't trust Red Robon to make a salad dressing that isn't full of sodium.

Let's see- I got a free birthday burger, or in my case a birthday Chicken caprese sandwich. I got a free birthday sundae without having anyone sing that gawd awful birthday song, and we got an advanced basket of bottomless fries while we waited for our food. It may be your typical burger serving chain restaurant but they stick to what they know and do it well.
Good chicken and burger options.  Great to bring the kids.  Bottomless Fries are always a hit.  Can be super busy during peak hours so be wary with the kids.
Yum.... Good food. Quick & attentive waiter, Great place for a bite while out and about in the Washington Square area.

I have to say I was surprised.  I asked for the Gluten free menu and received information on how best to navigate their menu in a gluten free manner.  It was pretty informative and easy to read, which is typically not the case when you get these sheets. I had a bacon cheese burger with iceberg lettuce for a bun with coleslaw instead of fries.  It tasted all good. They coleslaw had a lovely dressing on it with mustard in it.  Added some Tabasco to heighten the flavors and voila!  The burger was tasty and not dry.  Who can go wrong with bacon? I'd visit again, maybe try something else next.

Red Robin is my favorite burger joint. Had a funny experience the last time I went, and decided to write up a review about it. Me and my boyfriend took our son and our neighbor/friend, planning on meeting up with her girlfriend when she got there. As soon as we were seated, the waiter proceeded to shove his foot in his mouth, not once, but almost every time he approached our party for the whole time we were there. I felt really sorry for him because you could tell he knew it. He was friendly, but overly, and loud. Back to the food, it was great as usual, who doesn't love endless french fries? Gotta say, for a family restaurant, still pretty surprised with the drink menu, they have great drinks. Could have used more than one that night though.  =)

Nothing great here, your typical chain restaurant. They do offer bottomless french fries which is cool and they put seasoning on the fries which is tasty.  You do have to sit in the bar to get Happy Hour prices though, and weather you're in the bar or the restaurant it's VERY loud.  I suppose it would be a good place to go for families with children, that's about it. Don't take a date there and don't do a business lunch there, no one will be able to hear anything your saying.

So I frequent this location often. I've had some okay, and even the random good experience in the past here. HOWEVER when a friend and I went tonight we gave our card to the waitress she came back with two card declined slips. This made no sense as the balance was LITERALLY just checked prior to sending her away with the card, and there was a fair amount over the total balance of the check. We called the bank its said the card had first been approved for a balance far from what our total was from this location. It over drafted the account in fact. And then, the card was declined for times for the correct total. They stated they couldnt find the transaction, the waitress was quiet bitchy about the situation. And the management didnt want to refund the difference even after pulling up the bank statement and verifying that the transaction had indeed just came from his location. He also wasnt clear on what would happen if the charges went from pending to clear, and the account got over drawn. On top of that, they had the audacity to request we pay with another form of payment, even though they saw clearly the payment PLUS WAY MORE had already been taken from the account.  After making a fuss the manager gave us a card to call if the payment went threw and said hed take care of the meal. Either way service wasnt handled professionally and I am outraged by the situation.  We will never be going back to this location.  Its also too loud.
It's a chain burger restaurant with expensive burgers and not much to eat for vegetarians. Hummus plate is decent for happy hour.

Food is average... BUT Highly impressed by the waitress Amanda and their gluten free menu! Amanda is amazing she was educated about gluten free even when I had ordered a burger specifically---and presumably gluten free. She refilled waters quickly--which always earns points with me--brought sauce refills with out being asked and made completely sure my food was not contaminated whatsoever. Mind you, I'm not celiac, just gluten allergic and sensitive but was very impressed. Not to mention the restaurant was packed like sardines when we arrived and she was beyond on top of it.  Btw your gluten-free buns are great! Most places' taste like hockey pucks.

Okay, so understanding that this is a huge nationwide chain, and their food ranges in the $7-12 range, I'm not expecting to hop into a Red Robin and get five-star food and five-star service. It's not that I'm really counting--I'm not, but I've probably eaten at ten different Red Robin restaurants in three states--perhaps 30 visits total over the past 10 years.  It's not like we're there once a week. That said, this is about your average Red Robin, no better nor worse than the others.  The food here is decent.  Being December 23 and at the south end of a mall parking lot, it was understandably a zoo.  The service, in our visit, was really good.  We were seated within about 3 minutes.  Our orders were taken and the food arrived all within a span of perhaps ten minutes. Being calorie-conscious (more on that in a moment) I ordered the "Simply Grilled Chicken Sandwich".  It's just like it sounds.  A lovely chicken breast, plainly grilled but still flavorful and quite juicy.  Lettuce, tomatoes, red onion and pickle slices adorn the side--I used them all and created a lovely and flavorful 400-calorie sandwich.   Wife N. ordered her favorite: the Prime Rib Dip, hold the onions (as she dislikes onions).  Flavorful--certainly not the most fantastic dip ever but decent.   Now, all of the above total to a three-star rating, good, but nothing to drive across town for.   But there's some other stuff going on here that pushes this to a solid 4*s for us.  Here's why: 1. They have the most generous rewards program I've personally seen in a chain restaurant.  Buy 9 items, get one free. They also randomly just add in little freebies on the card---"surprise, you get a big shake for free"---yep, that's where I blew my calorie count yesterday, but that cookies-n-cream shake was OH SO GOOD! 2. Very family-friendly, and very-light-eater-friendly.  They always allow our 14-year-old-but-looks-16 daughter to eat from the kid's menu.  This is chain-wide, not just this store.  And they're totally happy to split any item onto two plates so two can share a light lunch.  In fact, we've been out with several light-eating adults whom they freely allowed to order off the kids menu---frankly, your age doesn't seem to matter to them: want a kids' meal? No problem. 3. All-you-can-stand fries.  I've found the initial load of fries to be getting smaller over time.  But you can always order more for free.  Anything that comes with fries is "bottomless" on the fries. 4. Bottomless drinks (except alcohol and shakes).  Any soda/pop is refillable and any of their cool creations like their Freckled Lemonade, Raspberry Limeade, etc. are also bottomless. 5. Burgers: honestly, great selection, great options, really good taste.  Zero complaints there. All in all, this is a really good place to eat for your average couple or family.  It's a bit loud, so maybe not the place place for two to have "romantic conversation" but as general out-shopping-with-the-family-hey-wanna-grab-a-bite-places it's definitely a good choice.

This place rules for what it is. A huge, national chain made for families.  They can make any burger into a vegetarian option, and their items make incredible veggie burgers. Service is always pretty good and even when they're busy it has never taken that long to get seated.  They also have some pretty decent local beers on their rotating taps. Good food that will fill everyone up for pretty cheap.

Red robin as a company is awesome. This location is so-so. I actually worked for red robin for awhile and there customer service standards are spot on, sadly this location seems to be hit or miss, sometimes u get good service, sometimes you don't.

I've definitely experienced better. Every time I go to Red Robins I am unimpressed with the quality of food and how much they charge for it.   The ambiance and decor is fun but not so much unique because it's a chain restaurant after all. It can get pretty loud but it's reasonable for a family-style restaurant. What I do like are their fries and the zesty seasoning you sprinkle on. The cocktail drinks and shakes are good but can add up your bill pretty fast. Service is usually pretty fast and the waitstaff is young and energetic.

This RR is less crowded and has very attentive servers. We went with the grand kids to celebrate their first day of school- ok it was their mom who was actually celebrating.. Hamburgers are stellar, fries are hot, crisp and endless. This months specialty drinks are over the top yummy! Haaapy haaapy tastebuds... Good thing I wasn't driving!! We will be back!!

If you've been to one Red Robin, you've been to them all...NOT! I signed up on the Red Robin website for a free birthday burger.  Last year, I had a less than fantastic experience at the Lloyd Center store while using my birthday burger coupon. There, our server tried to charge me for my burger and only give me the $.99 side for free. It took her manager to settle that debate. In the end, I got the burger for free (and paid for the side and tip) but I shouldn't have had to get management involved.  Last night, we chose to sit in the bar at the WA Square Red Robin and the bartender served us. Not only was she helpful, she was super nice and gave me ZERO grief about the gift certificate. We also ordered sides and drinks. Needless to say, she earned her 20% tip and turned my whole Red Robin opinion around.

We had a gift card so we came here to eat.  Red Robin can be hit or miss. This location is pretty good compared to some of the others I have been too. They had changed there menu since the last time I came here. So that was a little bit sad.  My food was good. My husband said his burger was just okay.
Food is OK but wow how slow can they be. Really 10 min to get my bill so j can get the help out of here!!!

This place is the best. Good service, great food, awesome servers. Can never go wrong going here. You deserve this 5 STARS !! Edit: I'd like to add my favorite is the Bruschetta Chicken and Banzai burger. My fiancé goes for the Prime Chophouse. Also try the garlic fries! They're AWESOME with the Chophouse sauce. They give dips for your fries! How awesome..... This is my cheat meal place. The bar is great too. The prices are above average, but its good food. I saw comments about slow service, but it was probably a busy night for them. My food normally comes out after 10-15 minutes. Fries are hot, burger well-done just like I asked. Kudos to this Red Robins.

Typical Red Robin. Our waitress was very nice, the food came quick, and the fries were restocked as soon as they were empty. I suggest ordering the grilled cheese for less than 4 dollars. It comes with bottomless fries. Don't forget to ask for smokey blue dipping sauce!
Great service at this Red Robin.  Food was fresh and hot.  Didn't have any complaints.
Really good burgers. Took one star off as it's not the best burger I've ever had. Decent prices $7 for a lunch meal (double cheeseburger, bottomless fries). Really yummy.

I love this place but for some reason my burger was slightly burnt tonight. Obviously I'm gonna keep coming back. Can't expect perfection 100% of the time. So tonight I'll give it a 95% which still gets 5 stars in my book.

This used to be my go to place for dinner with the fam.  (2 adults, kids 8 and 3).  The service has only continued to decline over the past year.  Tonight it took over an hour and a half to get through dinner, most of that time was spent waiting for drinks.  By drinks I mean juice and ice cream.  Seemed all drinks had to go through the bar tender and that was an issue.  Waitress was very inattentive and took multiple tries to ring the bill up right.  Bottomless fries, drinks and root beer floats are only bottomless if the waitress comes back from time to time and if the drinks can get to the table in under half an hour.
All I have to say is Brad! Best waiter ever! My friends and I always request him as a waiter! Food is always good :) we come here at least once a month!

A few reasons why you should just go elsewhere.  The food is severly over priced, the quality is no better than burger king. My wife and I now have an ongoing phrase, "it better quality and less expensive. Than Red Robin."  Honestly if you want quality food for the price and experience,  go to Thirsty Lion or Famous Daves.

Thank You! I brought my 2yr old daughter in today (09/14/14) for a daddy / daughter date. She has a significant peanut allergy. I've always had to be careful, and typically just don't take her out. Alexandra was my waitress. To say she was amazing just doesn't do justice. I told her of my daughter's allergy. She informed her manager, and the kitchen staff. On top of that, she bought out an Ipad with their menu, showing all the kids food that would be safe for her.  Besides her concern for my daughter, she was really on her game. It was really busy there today, and you could tell on the other waiters they seemed stressed. Not Alexandra. She stayed calm and cool. She really is the reason this Red Robin has repeat business.  Nice job Alexandra!!! I really appreciate you!!!

I went to red robin recently on a very slow day and got the worst service ever which is surprising for Red Robin. I know they try to pride themselves on good customer service. However, my husband and I decided to fill out an online customer review and we were contacted very promptly. The GM contacted us personally and seemed very genuine. What impressed us most is that there was an inaccurate phone number on our red robin royalty card. She finally got a hold of me by email. She didn't give up! She apologized, talked to the server we had the bad experience with and mailed us a gift certificate for dinner on them for two. I was so impressed with how kindly and promptly they addressed my complaint. This red robin rocks!!

We brought the family for dinner on Tuesday night for the Girl Scout fundraiser night. We got there at 620 pm. 10 minutes later we were seated. 15ish mins later we finally had a drink order taken. She said she'd take our food order after she put the drink order in. Came back WITH (some of) the drinks and left to take another table's order (a table that was seated after us). 25 mins after placing the drink order, my watered down lousy margarita arrived and THEN she finally took our food order. Once she took the food order, the food did arrive pretty quickly, although my sweet potato fries were cold and we had no condiments. Whatever. I don't expect the best meal of my life, we went to support my daughters organization. The food was the mediocre quality we expected. My problem was with the service. It was horrendous at best. I used to be a waitress, bartender, and dining room manager, so I'm not an idiot when it comes to running a restaurant. This was a combination of poor dining room management and apathetic, untrained servers. And seriously, I don't even think there was alcohol in that margarita.

First off you have to get Alx, She will take good care of you! I was working right by this restaurant when I was in town for a couple days. I loved it! I had not been to a red robins many times before then but I loved it every time! I tried the onion rings which was great, the tortilla soup even though it did not look like the picture on the menu it was still delicious! I also tried the chicken wrap for lunch once and it was quite filling, and only had half the wrap and was very content with it. Great red robins, the entire 10 days I was in town.. I did wonder about the remodeling patches on the wall haha
I had a terrible experience here. The fries and sandwiches were cold and I found a long blond hair in my sandwich. The only good thing was onion rings. It was way below my expectations.

Horrible layout in the bar area with no space. Sat at a table in the bar for 15 minutes without being acknowledged before leaving to go somewhere that could take time out of their busy schedule to serve us

We just finished our last visit to this Red Robin. This is the 2nd time we've received horrible service. We sat there for an hour before our food was served, and when it arrived it wasn't even hot. We were there to celebrate my 7 year old's birthday, so that was frustrating. The manager did come to our table to apologize, and we were quite surprised when he comped our entire meal (hence the 2 stars & not 1), but this is not a dining experience I would want to duplicate

Location: bar Cleanliness: I had to sit at a dirty table, 20 minutes later and the only table that has been cleaned is my own... Customer service: was greeted only AFTER the two waitresses finished their conversation about a party one of them was having and the gossip about a boy. Drinks: under 5 minute wait! Fabulous  Bartender: extremely friendly! Atmosphere: quiet

Red Robin is the best. They are accommodating to vegetarians with their boca burgers, the burgers are delicious, the fries are great, and the dipping sauces are sublime. I really can't think of a single negative thing to say.
Awful service, went in for pickup and took 45 minutes. 45 minutes JUST waiting for my food. All they could say was sorry. Horrible. Will never go back.

Time after time... the dirty bird does not dissappoint.  Good Beer, Good Fries, Good Burgers.  Their prices seem to keep going up but I guess it is par with the competition.  I remember when clucks and fries were like 6.75.  Now they are over $10.  I guess the bottomless fries are spendy to serve. Lol.  We came here last friday and had great service and food.  I had the bacon guac burger.  They also let me try a side of the ghost pepper sauce.  it was good.

ok burger. but the killer is the bottomless fries:( they give you like 10 fries at a time in a little stainless napkin holder. guys, your not fancy! your the same level as chilies... years ago (the last time i went to a RR) you got a damn basket of fries.. what the hell happened to that? If your gonna get fries order another batch as soon as your first ones come out and stay ahead of the game. Dissapointed i am.

I've been to plenty of Red Robins but only twice to this location. This last visit was only because it was convenient to do so. Service: First time here was pretty good. The server wasn't rude but she wasn't friendly either. Very neutral and she seemed to focus more on talking with her coworkers. Second visit the server was friendly but absent much of the time. I noticed another table with two teenish to college age girls were kind of abandoned, one freckled lemonade empty for a good five to ten minutes. When the server brought their food, they had asked for a sauce and another order of fries. Server never showed back up until she brought the check and they ended up getting boxes for their food and left. We did have a lot of time to sit around and wait too: waiting to have our orders taken, waiting to have our food served, and another wait to get the credit card back. It wasn't horrendous since my husband and I actually enjoy hanging out with each other so it wasn't silent and awkward but it was definitely a longer than usual wait for each action from the server. Luckily, after seeing what went on at the other table, we made sure to ask for sauces we needed at the time of ordering and when we got our food, we promptly asked for refills and another order of fries before the server disappeared again. Which was a good call, she really did just poof until she felt it enough time to bring the check. Food: If you get down the the foundations of a good burger, RR's patties are flavorless and the default buns are just meh bread. They do not season the meat at all so it really depends on your toppings and sauces to make it anything decent which is sad because the price has crept upwards and the burgers are the same quality. I have gotten the Sauteed Shroom burger many times so I know what to expect and it was the same quality as other locations. Very mild with the swiss and the light flavor of garlic from the mushrooms. Not horrible, but nothing to flail my arms and run a lap frantically around the restaurant about. I still haven't quite yet figured out how to make it better. My husband's Royal was better once he started asking for a cheese substitution and some mustard because otherwise it was meh too. The fries that came with the burgers were cold, limp, and so very sad. The second batch was hot, fresh, and crunchy and great with the campfire sauce. I am not quite sure why some people were complaining about their server not asking if they wanted more fries. Like with any complimentary thing, it's one of those selling points to bring people in but you don't actively push it or your business loses money needlessly. But it's not like they hide the fact since the menu and almost all the signage screams "OMG BOTTOMLESS FRIES". The small metal cup of fries is comparatively tiny when they used to fill half the basket before but it's wasteful. Sure you'd like to see a pile of fries you couldn't possibly finish served with your burger but that's foodstuffs that's going in the trash later. Isn't it better to get manageable batches at a time that you can finish and then get more if you still want more? It's still bottomless fries. What's the big deal? TL;DR: Service is kind of on the bad side. Prep ahead and order what you need before you need it (sauces, refills, and such). Food isn't bad but it could be better. Don't expect the patties to be seasoned; the toppings are what will make it taste better. Fries are bottomless. Order more if the tiny cup isn't enough when you get it.

I love RR but this location is horrible. The restroom is never clean, the floors are always wet and I fell the last time I came in. The manager never even came to check on me. After writing a complaint email he did call and said my next dinner was on him and sent me a gift card. Not to sound unappreciative but the gift card wasn't even enough for a meal for my husband and myself. I feel like he could have at least bought us an entire meal after I got wet, dirty and hurt in their dirty restroom.  Also, service is horrible. Never again - and I mean it this time!

So I think I'm just done with this location. I have never had a problem with the food. It's always been on par with other red Robin locations. I cannot stand being seated in the dining room, as my wife, baby daughter and I do not appreciate the loud server singing. So we sit in the bar area. After the remodel the bar area is uncomfortably cramped. So okay, no more dining in house, we'll just order, "to go". This has been unbelievably challenging as every time I call to place an order, no one will pick up the phone. 3 weeks ago my wife called and on the second attempt a person answered. When she returned home with the "to go"  order half of it was wrong. Skip to today around 3pm. I called this location THREE TIMES before someone picked up. The Third time I called I just let it ring for five minutes. Finally a gentleman answered and asked if I could hold? Before I could answer I was on hold.  He just never came back after that. I went and ate at "The Thirsty Lion"  instead. I understand that this location is high volume due to its close proximity to Washington Square, but this was the last straw. If you can't bother to pick up the phone, then I won't bother to spend my money with your company anymore.

Avoid this place at all costs. Scattered service only worried about high turnover rates $$, fast food chain atmosphere, lackluster decor, GMO processed food with bland flavor. Portland has more to offer family dining than this caliber of restaurants. Reconsider your level of desperation before choosing this one.

This is one of the more consistently good Red Robin locations. The servers are friendly, attentive and timely. We had Mitchell today and he is excellent!! This location is beautifully newly remodeled and has plenty of room so you shouldn't wait long. The food is consistently hot and fresh. We really have no complaints! Our favorite location around here for sure!

Horrible service! We sat and we were not even acknowledged! Mind you, they were not even busy! After 20 minutes, we decided to leave. Only then did the waiter acknowledge us by saying "thanks. Have a good night guys." Thanks for what? You never even brought us water!  We have been to this location a few times and each time the service gets worse and worse. If we are going to Red Robin, we will be going to the Beaverton location.

This has a great selection of appetizers.  I almost always split a couple of appetizers and that works fine, without the meal.  I like the bar area where I can sit down without waiting.  Provided I have a good waitress, who does not have the appearance of getting ready to clock out and does not like her job, I have a good impression.
We waited over 40 minutes for us to get our food after we ordered. The server only checked on us only once, silverware had dried food and had to wait 20 minutes for our bill.

Huge place. Tried few items:   Fiery Ghost Tavern Double (The Big Ghost with one patty: well done): Awesome (great spice and flavorful): Had it on multiple occasions: our favorite at Red Robin.   Burnin' Love Chicken: My wife really liked it.   Smoke and Pepper Burger (well done): Pretty Good, but not as good as the Fiery ghost... huge patty.   Ensenada Chicken Platter: This was just amazing... loved the sauce it came with.     A1 Peppercorn Burger (well done): was just okay.     One of their limited time items: Sir'Acha Tavern Double: wasn't as spicy as they portray... and the sesame bun does not go well with it Sides:     Wedge/flat fries (comes with to-go) were good once, not so good on another occasion.     However dine-in bottomless fries were good.    Garlic fries: really good (but they charge $1.49 extra just to put some garlic on top)    Onion rings (had it on a to-go order: so not so good): Likely good in restaurant. Wish the server brought out dishes as they were ready.   Our ensenada dish was a little cold by the time it was served to us.

Husband and I were hungry (hangry monsters calling at the door). We walked in and looked around while waiting for a hostess to seat us. And waited. And ... waited. And waited some more. Finally someone came around to greet us and seat us. They originally tried to seat us at the sardine booth and we requested a larger booth. When this occurred the hostess rolled her eyes at us and put the menus on the table and abruptly left.  We waited about 5 minutes to order appetizers when our waitress finally came around.  Looking around the restaurant wasn't super busy but tables were definitely spread out. Looking at who was serving we could only visibly see 2 servers waiting on roughly 20 tables. So about 10 tables a piece. We ordered our food and requested that the food come out after the appetizers. We ate our appetizers which came out with a reasonable time, and then began to wait for our food. And waited.... Waited some more.... And continued to wait.... 45 minutes have passed and we ask our waitress if our food was planning on coming out anytime soon. She says yes and disappears for another 15 minutes. All the while drinks have gone empty and my husband is falling asleep at the table while waiting for our food. Looking around at other tables that arrived just before us or after - tables that had gotten there after had already gotten their food. Frustrated I ask the waitress again how come other tables that were seated after us got their food but we hadn't. She apologized again and disappeared for another 10 minutes. We were short of leaving because our food had yet to arrived and have gotten better service at other restaurants that were still open closer to home when our food finally showed up. After finishing our food we had to run our waitress down for the bill otherwise we'd have been sitting there for another 30 minutes. Luckily for the restaurant my husband and I were not in a hurry as we had already been there well over an hour waiting on our food, but the service over all wasn't the greatest. I've been to other Red Robins with faster (and hotter) food along with waitresses/waiters/host staff that actually smile. Everyone we interacted here seemed like they were just putting on a show and not genuinely interested in being there. Husband and I won't come back to this Red Robin based on this experience.

"That's so gay...!!!" No - I am not referring to this so-called restaurant with that (to me) offensive statement... that was the first comment my partner and I overheard after being seated in the Bar next to a table of off-duty Red Robin employees... So - it's a Thursday night around 8:00 p.m.  The place is not crowded (except, it seems, with an over-abundance of RR employees, both on and off-duty).  We were led from the uncrowded dining area of the place to the crowded (literally, with regard to space, and also with the # of parties seated there) Bar (just squeezing between stools at the Bar and the adjacent tables was risking bruising a hip or leg the space is so tight).  We were seated at a table next to one with two off-duty RR employees (later, to be joined by two others who were just getting off duty, and also populated, at various times, by other on-duty employees who just seemingly stopped by to chat or drop a line or two into the ongoing inane conversations (including the afore-mentioned "that's so gay" comment that was dropped as soon as we sat down). OK - as a former restaurant GM, I have some serious questions about this place... One - why does a place have so many wait staff?  On a Thursday night? Two - how can the bartender keep up with her job while simultaneously (and constantly) talking inane drivel with both customers (one, a man, seemingly someone of long-term patronage) and on-duty and off-duty employees alike.  Granted, the woman seems to have a "sparkling" personality - but - she did not shut up the whole time we were seated there.  Maybe it would have been Ok (and perhaps entertaining) but seriously, she was talking some really inane B/S most of the time. Three - off duty employees should NEVER be seated next to customers who are dining... in this case, the employees were drinking, talking loudly, and, as noted, saying things that were offensive to the two customers seated right next to them. (We were waiting for the heavy-set blonde one to say "that's so gay" one more time  so we could have said, in unison, "Oh, that's so straight fat white girl" loud enough to be overheard). The service was, at best, poor and "ho hum".  Our waitress took our order and delivered it - and that's all we saw of her until she came at the end to try to "up sell" a dessert or "another drink for you two?".   We had a Cobb salad and a cup of French Onion soup (besides our drinks) and it took about 1/2 hour for the order to be filled and delivered.  I OVER-tipped - not out of gratitude, but as a compensation to stifle my desire to 1) stiff our waitress and 2) not make a scene, upon leaving, telling the fat str8 white girl how offensive she was. The food - nothing to write home about with praise... it was food, yes, but over-priced for what we got and the overall "dining experience" that was Red Robin. We are from out of state - so unlikely that we'll ever return.  If we were local, we would surely NOT return (except, perhaps, with a cadre of queer folk to picket the place for being out-of-line with "funny" remarks such as "that's so gay"...

Poor greetings by hostess. Told multiple times they will be right with us as soon as they can like robots after being told it will be just a few minutes. Garlic fries now consist of garlic powder  salt and generic wax like cheese. Burgers were fine. Fries were cold. Poor server was in borderline tears. Friends bread was stale ish. With the Thirsty Lion across the street and for the same price I will never come back here. Corp Food at its finest....

I'd love to say that going to this Red Robin was a great experience, but then that'd make me a  liar. See, the service was just terrible tonight. I won't be going back, and will be actively making passive-aggressive jokes about tonight's dinner until social media decides to go back to focusing on the Game Of Thrones season finale. The only difference between RR and GOT is that at least you go into GOT expecting to get fucked somehow.

Came in asked for a table for 5 was told it would be 15 mins didn't even feel like that long. Sat down and our waiter Gabby was awesome! Request her! Very attentive and fast. Took our orders and everything came back really good. Sharing 2 orders of onion rings between 5 people (1 tower($9) and 1 shorty ($5)) was very filling. Ordered about 4 burgers (1 to go) and 1 soup/blta combo and a chicken one(forgot the name) food came out a little after we ordered but everything was fresh. I would recommend this one.
The only good thing was our waiter Mitchell!We now have been at the restaurant 65 minutes and no food.  When my soup and salad came it was without Chili!  Never again!!
It was the waitress first day but the whole service at this place sucks. Wait time was horrible and the food was just unacceptable.

Upon a second visit to this location, I am changing my score, the service was great, the food was much improved. The fries with the burger were still not as hot as I would have preferred, but the faster service and second basket of fries were hot.

Red Robin by the numbers- Line out the door with 30+ people waiting and I can count at least 10 empty/clean tables.  They tell us the wait time is 30 minutes. M Is this really how to run a restaurant? We come here because it's close but honestly 5 Guys is waaaaay faster and equally good.  Next time that's where we'll be going.

Update... The management reached out to us and asked us to give them another try. This time the waiter did a good job stopping by to get the order, drop the food off, then the check. Found out they just changed policy so no unlimited fries before your burger arrives unless you want to pay extra. The unlimited Mac n cheese is gone to one serving too.  Even though I requested an unpressed burger made as juicy and pink as possible.. It was dry and well done. Had to send back the pasta so it could be warned up. Felt like warm sauce poured over cold pasta.  The fries were fresh and hot! Couldn't have asked for better chocolate milks!  None of the leftovers were worth bringing home. Original... Very underwhelmed.. Nearly walked out while waiting for the food to arrive. When it did, we got the food it was piecemeal. The food was all over cooked. The burgers and chicken were nearly dry enough to be considered dehydrated. The sparse fries were cold and tasted over cooked. We had to send people to find our waiter several times. The kids chocolate milks may have been shown a chocolate syrup bottle but little to none actually went into the cup with the milk.  This is a sad change from our usual service. We normally are very happy with our meals and service.., maybe it is the night or just this location.

Not impressed. Service was horrible. She never refilled our water and brought us the wrong burgers. She asked us if we wouldn't mind eating them anyways, we decided to eat them because we had waited such a long time already.  I couldn't finish mine because it was raw. I was supposed to get my burger for free because of my birthday this month but she said I was one day too late. That figures. I will never eat at the Washington Square Red Robin again.

Why do I even bother with this chain? Not just this location, but any location I've been to really can't change my mind for this review. Today was especially dreadful. Sat in the bar with my wife, as we normally do to avoid the dreaded "wait." Our server stopped by really quick with menus and asked for drinks. As I hadn't even finished sitting down, I declined a drink at that point. I then fiddled around with their new fangled kiosks that allow you to order drinks and food without talking to a person. After today's experience, the machine might have been more helpful. Our server came back, I ordered a beer, and we placed our food order. I had the new southern charm burger, extra pink, fries, bacon aioli and a side wedge salad. Wife ordered the Avo Cobb salad, no tomatoes and a side of fruit.  Lunch was in full swing, bar was full, but not packed, and servers/ bartender seemed to be in a nice spot.  Both our sides came out after about 10-15 minutes, which was nice since we were getting nicely hungry. My wedge was standard, and enjoyable. The wife's "fruit salad" appeared to be the same stuff the bar dumps into wine for their sangria. Frozen strawberries, canned mandarin oranges, and diced apple. Not super thrilled with the offering.  Her Cobb salad had tomatoes, and the garlic "toast" was more like garlic "charcoal." My burger came out with a side of raw baby carrots, not fries. Both entrees came out just a few minutess after the sides had been dropped, and the runner tried to give it to the table behind us. I think our server could tell something was wrong, as she showed up right after the food was dropped. We told her about the missing fries, and my wife's salad having tomatoes in it when requested without.  She looked at us like a deer in the headlights, asked us what we wanted her to do, and then blamed it all on the kitchen. My wife proceeded to pick off the tomatoes, as its not an allergy, just preference, and some fries were brought out to me.  Think that settles everything? Nope! Fries were cold, and not very crisp.  The only up side to this whole thing is my burger did have "some pink" and we didn't have to wait over an hour to eat at the Cheesecake Factory like we'd planned. Sorry Red Robin, your mediocre food, crummy service, and lack of concern trying to make a guest happy have lost you some business.

I know these are largely first world issues but if I'm going to pay $12.50 for a burger, I expect better service. I went there twice in a month. One time is was uncrowded and the other time it was super crowded. Both times we were completely ignored. We had to ask 3x for condiments and cutlery. Their stupid useless tablet thing was not working one time. The worst was the stupid door closed on my son's leg and he has a huge bruise. No one cared at red robin. They are grossly understaffed because they have those stupid tablets. They suggest a tip which is what I would give a full-service server. Red robin is overworking their staff and overworking their customers too. When I pay that much, I want to sit there on my butt and eat greasy food; not spend the majority of the time asking for stuff and navigating my way around their stupid tablets. Plus, their food was cold the last time I went. Never going again.

We have eaten at Red Robin before and had a very positive experience, but our last few visits have been awful. We were in the Tigard area and decided to give it another try. I ordered my favorite crispy chicken salad and the BF got one of the premium burgers. We were starving and the food took a long time. When it came out, we were psyched. But as soon we started eating, things went down hill. Everything was cold. The chicken on my salad was not freshly cooked. It was cold and dried up like it had been cooked and cut up hours before. The accompanying "warm" flatbread was two pieces of dried French bread that was dry, unseasoned, and stone cold. It dissolved into dust when you bit into it.  The burger was heavily spiced with poultry seasoning for some odd reason. It tasted like stuffing. And it was cold. We asked for more fries as soon as our food came out. They arrived after we finished and were...you guessed it...stone cold. Never again.  But the water was good.  This is not a cheap restaurant. I have had better burgers and chicken at fast food restaurants for a fraction of the price.  I wish we had gone to McDonalds.

One star is over rated.  This restaurant is my kids favorite.  :(. Now they don't ever want to eat their again.  In less than 3 mths on 3 separate occasions we have had terrible sickness and diarrhea.  Up all night with stomach pain that was excruciating.  A stomach bug I put it down to the first time when my child was off school vomiting for 2 days solid.  But 3 times is no coincidence! I mentioned to my hair dresser her daughter also had the same experience from same location.   So disappointed, for my sons favorite place to be so infected.  Food also turned out freezing cold. We all had different meals.  Is it the hygiene or the food??

After writing my initial review, Red Robin reached out to me an encouraged me (with the help of a gift card) to give them another try. I've been back three times since and the food and service has improved slightly. The service has been hit and miss, but was particularly disappointing when I came with five other co-workers. Our server rarely checked in on us and we sat around for 20 minutes after our meals were finished waiting for a check and boxes. I've tried a few other food items and they were ok.
Worst experience Food came in late and was cold when it came.  Least responsive staff.   Ordered sauce for fries and waiter disappeared.   Not coming to this location here

Updated: Me and my fiancé went back to give them another try. The service was much better and our waitress was very nice and quick.  Old Review: I will not go back to this location. It's a Monday, and not very busy. I ordered my drink and food the same time as the couple next to me. They got their drinks right away. I had to wait 25 mins to get my drink and all I got was a Dr. Pepper. Shortly after getting my drink, the couple next to me got their food. I had to wait another 45 mins to get my food and all I ordered were the boneless wings. When I got my food, not only was it extremely cold, but it was over cooked. The chicken was so hard to eat and very dry/chewy. They hardly had any barbecue sauce on them. Then when I went to pay for my food, the waitress takes off with my money, tells me she's going to get me change, and takes 3 other tables orders in the mean time. Another 20 mins later she tells me she forgot she had my money in her pocket and is going to look for change....finally I get my change and she shorts me on my change. After flagging her down she tells me that she is bad at math and gave me the rest of my change...
Okay so I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants but I do admit that I love red robin. I love the banzai burger, their steak fries and their strawberry lemonade.
Restaurant is 1/3 full and we still have a 10 min. wait because servers aren't here.  12:07 pm.   Super lame.  And very very slow service --25 minutes

Good food of course it's Red Robin.  Service is not up to par though.  Been here multiple times and thought maybe the poor service was a snafu, but it has been consistently poor. We were not in the bar area and just an observation the bar has very attentive service.  The servers are plentiful but they clump up and ignore there tables.

This location had possibly the worst hamburger I have ever been served (with the exception of a place in Lloyd's Center). I asked for fruit salad as my option.  Wretched. It smelled and tasted musty. How can I explain it?  Like an old closet filled with old boots and socks... Had it exchanged for broccoli--- which was the same musty, old garbage as the fruit salad-- only in vegetable form. Husband's food not good either-- and fries were mushy and cold. Nothing done to remedy anything except waitress said she didn't like the fruit salad either. Oh--And they took 38 cents off the bill for the fruit salad. So disappointing as I just wanted to eat a decent hamburger. It was over-cooked, dry, and luke warm so I think it was leftover from lunch as was my husband's hamburger and fries.   I've been to decent Red Robin's but this wasn't one of them. Never again-- anywhere.

Had a great time. Bartender was very nice even though I never expect employees to act like they're my best friends, because that's stupid. Food took a little longer than expected, probably because of something behind the scenes that I didn't know about and can't account for because I don't f*cking work there. But hell, I'm not the one cleaning the dishes! Drinks were great. ^_^

Our waiter Bryan seemed like he was in his own little world. He couldn't answer questions about menu items and the only thing he said throughout our meal was "everything okay?" and "need more fries?" Our waters were never refilled and I thought the service couldn't get poorer. But I was proven wrong. We wanted to use a coupon that said 50% off of a hamburger and we were splitting the bill. Shouldn't be a problem right? Well Bryan took 20 minutes to come back to our table and tell us that the coupon couldn't be used on a split check because it was buy one get one half off, however there was no such verbiage on the coupon that said anything about a BOGO, it just said 50% off a burger. The manager (who couldn't be bothered to give us her name) came over and wasn't much better. She said the mailer would have more details on the coupon but who brings in a whole mailer with them to a restaurant?! I usually don't give poor reviews but this constituted a very poor one. Bryan is either new or does not belong in a job where he must be personable, knowledgeable and move with a sense of purpose. As for the manager, do a better job training your people because this sort of service should never be acceptable at ANY level in a restaurant. When you are across the street from a restaurant that has similar prices, much friendlier wait staff/management and a staff that moves with a sense of urgency, you need to hold yourselves to a higher standard and I'm not sure that this staff is capable of that. I was majorly let down this evening. Very poor showing Red Robin.

Took my niece out to dinner.  Took several minutes to even be acknowledged up front at the hostess stand.  Ordered reasonably quickly.  My niece's food was decent, but my California Chicken was inedible.  The fries they brought out were cold.  We tried to order another round but we never saw our waitress again.  We paid using the machine on the table.  This restaurant clearly doesn't care about service.  I'd give it a '0' if I could...

Tonight we were served by Maddy and she was so wonderful! The quickest service I've ever received at a red robin. She made special requests after the fact and gave us all the sauces and fries we wanted fast and correctly. She was wonderful!

I just went to a Red Robin for the first time three days ago and I'm so glad I chose this one!!  First of all, the food and service were both great.  I left and arrived home about 80 miles away, only to discover I had left my planner, i.e. my brain, in the restaurant booth. I called the restaurant, and sure enough, it was there.  I offered three times to pay the postage to have it returned, but Amanda Johnson refused my money and sent it to me FedEx, presumably at her own expense. This is WAY above the call of duty and I was so impressed I called and spoke to the manager.  Next time I'm in Tigard, I know where I'm going to eat, and I recommend everyone support this awesome business.  Thank you Amanda and Red Robin!!

Decent burger, they always are happy to tell you about bottomless lemonade and bottomless fried, but it is in inconvenient to ask for more when they even rarely come by again.  They you only get about 15 fries each time.

went in today and tried the poutine fries and they were sooooooo good. i've had poutine a few times and i really like red robin's poutine. also the service was fast and very friendly and kept my water filled. the mac and cheese burger was also very good but the poutine was amazing.

I've been to Red Robin many times in my life and I've always liked it. It's always been a "safe" choice. If you want good beer, bottomless fries, gourmet burgers and other fried snackables,  at a reasonable price this is your place! Customer service is good ,our server checked on us often enough.I was surprise because it was a full house. Not usually one to rave about chain restaurants but I'll be back.

I swear - this is true of every RR I "have" to visit because my nephew loves the mac&cheese....there are always empty tables (at least 40%) and you ALWAYS have to wait....I don't understand this business model at all!!!!

I love the bottomless fries here. The onion ring tower is always good. Unfortunately the burgers have just been ok the last few times I've been here. I'm not sure what changed. They used to have decent burgers... now I"m always a little disappointed when I go.

There was a wait backed up at the door and the restaurant is nearly empty. Went to the bar and the bartender was chatting with her friend for 5 minutes while I sat there. Also, they claim to be a gourmet burger place but they only offer burgers cooked "some pink" and "no pink". That's pathetic

Came here with my Dad and Boyfriend. They have such an awesome happy hour! $2.50 beer. $4.50 wings that are to die for! I got the buffalo sauce, usually I don't like buffalo sauce, but this was perfect! Our waiter was very attentive too. Great service and great food!

Man...  I am just so increasingly disillusioned by this RR.  I'm not a HUGE fan to begin with, but it was my dad's birthday and my mom suggested we go here because he gets a free burger (bless her heart) and they will sing and embarrass him. It's been more than a year since i've been to RR. So we go.  And we wait. Get seated.  Waiter comes by fairly quickly for drink orders.  Then we wait.  And we wait.  And we wait.  He has to keep bringing things (drinks) one by one because they aren't ready yet.  And we wait.  And we wait.  Waiter is super nice.  Rob.  Not his fault.  35 minutes on a Monday to get our food.  Table of 5.  Nothing crazy.  Nothing special order.  35 minutes.  No updates.  No apology for the incredibly slow service.  No "here's some fries while you wait, sorry the kitchen is really backed up." Our plates come out, the woman who delivered our food was rude.  RUDE. (wish I had caught her name, but older, maybe in her 40's with very short dark hair.) We asked for certain sauces when we ordered.  The waiter ASKED us if we wanted sauces.  We said which ones.  Normal.  She was RUDE when we asked for our sauces, like we were asking her to go our back, pick some tomatoes, stew them, then make BBQ sauce and mix it with some mayo made from the eggs she also needed to go collect so we could have our sauce.  Comes back all huffy.  Still missing sauces but at this point, why bother.  We each have 6 fries on our plates.  6.  I took a picture.  And counted!  Seriously guys.  So we ask the waiter for another round of fries.  They come out after we have finished our food. And each of us got a "refill" with about 10 fries.  Moving up in the world.    This is not the first negative experience here.  Food is always slow.  But it is one that has dictated we won't be back to this location.  If it weren't for Rob, the whole night would have been a loss.

Their kinda petty and I don't like petty. They would not allow me to use a coupon because it was dine in only and I was in a hurry to get to an appointment. I had called in my order to go and Jacob refused to give it to me unless I paid full price when I got there, even though I told him it was to go over the phone and I told him which coupon o had. We are talking about $4 difference here, that's it. It was the principle. Plus I had a couple bucks for tip which made the difference more like two bucks. Sorry I didn't read the 2 point font on the bottom of the coupon regarding dine in only, especially since all the other couples were take out allowed (see my pic).  If they think that I would have bought more had I sat down, their so wrong. What I did was save them from cleaning a dirty table and a server who would have to bring waters and come back and forth to check on me. Because my purse was next to the bag on the RR counter, the bag of made food I never got to take with me, it got teriyaki sauce on my purse somehow. So my purse got food, but I went to my appointment hungry. The rest of the day I could smell the terriyaki sauce on my purse, making me even more hungry Grrr...  Perhaps I should be thankful, getting sauce all over the paper bag which got on my handbag by simply being next to it on their counter is kinda sloppy, it would have gotten on my non leather fabric seats had they given me the paper bag, which would have stained and really sucked. Oh yeah, I've eaten their food before. The flavor is decent, but the overall value of the food is so-so and I think you all know how I feel about the service level.
Service at tables is hit and miss for quality but I've never had a bad experience sitting at or in the bar area.
This Red Robin loves to pile people in the waiting area and have waits for long periods when over half the restaurant is completely open. Food was okay for the value.  Our server was great though.

It is what it is. Most people going in know that it's a nationally run burger joint. Food is good, service is usually top-notch. My kids love coming here.  Only complaints are these:  While I understand they're trying to attract more adults into their establishments, they shouldn't forget what made them so popular, families with kids. They are changing the restaurants to more adult style themes, and moving away from more family-centered decor.  The other is simply the prices. Which can be a little outrageous for some of their "higher end" burgers. Cmon, $15 for a burger and fries, I can still get a steak dinner elsewhere for that price.  Other than those 2, you know the deal. It's a national burger restaurant.

9 tables in the entire restaurant at 4pm, and tbe hostess wants to take my name? I ask  " excuse me? There is a wait?" They seat us 10 minutes later, with attitude. Just annoying... too many other places to go to justify...

Honestly, the 5 stars is due to the service Patrick gave while my husband and I were there for lunch. We've frequented many Red Robin's from Arizona, Nevada, Washington and Oregon and he gave us the best customer service we've yet to have. We ordered the Spinach and Artichoke Dip for our appetizer and found ourselves to be out of chips with a whole lot of tasty dip left...  He asked us if we'd like another order of chips. This has never happened and we order this every single time when we dine. The chips came out fresh and hot. We' come back to this location just for his customer service instead of going to the one about 3 miles from our home.

On June 1st, I put in an online order, around 4 pm to pick up at 6:30. Long story short, left around 7:30 with no food. They had part of the order done about 10 min after I arrived, then left the food sitting, with no heat, for over 25 minutes! Spoke with the manager, he was unapologetic, and offered nothing other than remaking the order. I was done waiting. ( as were a couple of other people having the same experience) I asked for a refund. Now it's June 6.  No refund. 53$ I could use. Biggest problem for me was the supreme lack of customer service. For all of us waiting. Sad. I used to enjoy eating there. Not anymore.

I am very allergic to gluten and said that in the beginning as well as reminded. When I got my avocobbo salad it had TWO PIECES OF BREAD ON TOP. I've been laying in bed for the past three hours in horrible pain. Because I'm sure the dressing also had gluten in it. Slow service and did not get happy vibes from anyone.

This place is horrible. Service was terrible and the manager was it's leader. Flat soda, no water, and sat us 15 minutes after we got there to an almost empty restaurant right next to bussing station.  When we asked to move the manger said he couldn't move us. Again, almost empty restaurant.  After my meal when I showed them my rewards card and that it was my birthday they couldn't "find" my free burger. So the manager gave me a card for a free milkshake. WOW! That was nice.  Wouldn't even let me use it for the milkshake I had just drank. Do not go here. Baja Fresh or even the mall food court would do you better.  1 star because I have to put a star

Wow where to begin.... My family and I love Red Robin and we usually have exceptional service at this location however, the last two times we've dined there service as well as quality has been sub par. Today my family and I went in for an early dinner. When ordering I noticed that they no longer had the "Tavern Fires" on the menu. I asked the server if it was still available and she responded, "it should be". So we placed our order for the Tavern Fries and a couple of burgers. Well after a while we noticed that all the other tables around us had their appetizers and it had been a little over 15 minutes since we ordered and our Tavern Fries and hadn't received anything yet. We stopped the server to ask her about it and she looks at us confused and says "Oh let me check with the kitchen" she returns to let us know they no longer have that on the menu. Ok... so why didn't you tell us that when we ordered it 15 minutes ago???? Anyway we decided to just drop it and wait for our food. Shortly after our food was bought to the table. I bit into my Pig Out Tavern Double and notice a funny taste. I open it up to see that they put blue cheese in my burger instead of the regular american cheese. So I waived down the server and tell her that I have blue cheese in my burger. She grabs it from me, no I apologies , I will have another one made nothing! Just takes it from me and returns to the kitchen... OK so I assumed they were making another one.... another 15 minutes later I stop her again asking on the status of my burger. She goes back to the kitchen and returns with the burger.. No I'm sorry! Nothing just puts the burger down. Fine I'm ready to eat... Perfect just the way I like it, even though now, my family is all done with their dinner. Fast forward to the end I go to pay the bill and noticed that I have 2 tavern burgers on my bill WTF... My patience is now wearing thin. I stop the manager to explain and all I get is .... Oh they just forgot to take it off. That's it.. Now I come from a customer service background and I understand that mistakes are made and I don't expect free stuff, but when you messed up more then once in one seating I believe some type of discount should be made... I guess the manager overheard me so she offered $5.00 off. Really talk about a slap in the face! I would of at least removed the $8.99 burger and apologized for the mess up.... I guess we will be going to another location. Oh and I forgot to mention this was during a very slow period there was no more then 5 tables in the restaurant at the time.

Time to update my review.    Entered the restaurant between lunch and dinner crowds.  I was greeted with a smile and provided the menu promptly.    My drink order was received pretty fast.  I then ordered the Clucks and Fries which is really chicken strips and fries.  My food was received within 10 minutes... Which is pretty great. Unfortunately the chicken strips were overcooked and dry inside.  The fries were good.  There didn't appear to be a manager around. Apparently when things are slow everyone congregates in the lounge and watches TV, instead of cleaning tables, the floor and taking care of the many other things they could.  They were loud and very noticeable.  I have noticed some personnel change here recently, I do not know if people are just on vacation or?  The other prior employees did not seem to be like this.

I've absolutely had it with the management at this Red Robin.  It's 6:30pm on a Wednesday evening and they have a 30 minute wait with 14 open tables.  Yes, they don't have the wait staff to cover the capacity on a night when they will do busy with the heat in Portland.  If this was a one-time deal, I'd be ok with it, but it's happened over and over again.  It's unacceptable and may be the last time we come here.  I hope that Red Robin upper management reads this and makes some major staffing changes, such a disappointment as our kids love it here.

I wanted a burger, kinda last minute decision for dinner, and this location is not far from my house, so we decided to go.  We went around 6:30 on a Thursday night, were told the wait was 15-20 minutes even though we could see open tables all around the restaurant.  We only waited maybe 10 minutes and were seated.  The server came to get our drink order promptly, and the water and a beer arrived fairly quickly.   We ordered 2 burgers, and then we waited, and waited, and waited.  Several tables who were seated after us got their meals before us.  Our server didn't come by to check on us or give us an update.  The meals arrived, the fries were lukewarm and the mushroom burger bun was soggy (from the mushrooms I guess?), like it had been sitting awhile before being delivered. The bacon cheeseburger was well-done to the point of being really dry, but the onion rings were fresh and hot.  Our server came to check on us, we told her about the fries, and she promptly brought a basket right out of the fryer. We waited again for the check to be brought, but then the server was quick to process it. Summary:  the food is OK, but a little expensive for what you get, the room is noisy, and the service is slow.  As an overall dining experience, the good doesn't outweigh the bad for me.

After sitting for multiple minutes contemplating whether not I should get a mocha shake I decided I should go for it. Approximately 10 minutes later my milkshake comes out, another waitress that was not mine own set it down on the table and quickly walked away. Soon I came to the realization that my milkshake was lacking the sprinkles. My level of disappointment was through the roof.

Called in a to-go order this evening that my husband nicely offered to go pick up after a long day. Saturday evening about 8:30pm. Husband got all the way home only to realize the ranch and campfire sauce we asked for were not there, the French fries were bland with no seasonings what so ever, the burgers we ordered without tomato came WITH tomatoes. My family has been coming here for big family dinners for almost 6 years. (And by big family dinners I mean 10-13 people every time.) We have spent lots of money at this location and it just seems to keep going downhill. I think we are done with this location, I'll drive the extra 10 minutes to another one.

This is the worst location. 30 minute wait people were called to be seated that just got there! Lots of bacon tables but we were being skipped because we were a smaller party. Another 10 minute wait to take her order even though we told them we were ready for me were seated! Food took forever. Tons of messy non cleaned tables! This is the third time we've been here and the same thing has happened! But we had the most amazing server named Alex! She was fast, accurate, friendly, takes pride in her job and saved the night!

Came in here today around 3:30 pm. The place was dead. The only reason the place is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is because our server was really nice.  The food is just okay, the shroom burger was tasty but boring no lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle nothing. Just a bun, burger, cheese, and mushrooms. Sweet potato fries we got we're old and refried, stale, hard and cold. Steak fries with the other burger was old, stale, and cold. The burgers are so small, you can get a big Mac meal for cheaper at McDonald's.  We decided to order a second batch of fries to see if they'd be cold. Steak fries came out first, cold, stale, old obviously from.the same batch. Sweet potato fries were hot and fresh the second time around. I took pictures of both fries so you can see the difference in the color with the old fries and the fresh ones.  We let the server know that the steak fries were unacceptable. And so were the first batch of sweet potato fries. He said he'd tell a manager who was 20ft away. They took 2 measly dollars off our bill. The manager who wasn't far was standing around talking to some people didn't even bother to come over and apologize or address the problem.  Overall we will NEVER visit another red Robin again. I'd suggest going to cheesecake factory up the road instead. Gourmet burgers? I think not.. no where close, I'd rather go to five guys.
I like to take my son to dinner there once a month. The menu has great selection. The service is friendly and we always enjoy it.

I can always count on a good burger and fries at Red Robin. There are always too many options. I tried some kind of burning love burger (no I don't remember the exact name). The burger was topped with fried jalapeño coins and jack cheese. This also included a whole jalapeño which was not roasted enough, meaning not with a charred caramelized goodness. I substituted sweet potato fries. They were good, not great. Wish they were steak fries instead of shoe string.

It's sad when you order items and are very specific and they still get it wrong.  Especially when it's a manager (Dimano) who brings out your order and you tell him and he never returns.  Then the server comes over and closes the blinds next to us and dust comes off of them as they're filthy.  Same manager, we said something when he brings our order. He states "we've been busy and haven't had time to clean them"! REALLY. What's the kitchen look like than? SMH I've tried twice in the last month to go here. They sure DON'T make it easy to want to come back....
Nice place for a quick lunch, server was great I don't remember her name. Food was ok, I would have liked to see some dark beer though.

I feel like Red Robin is always a hit or miss. My favorite is the whiskey bbq chicken wrap. You can get bottomless fries before your entree comes out and they're always amazing. The last time I ordered the wrap it was over dressed and soggy. They charge you $.75 for a little cup of their "specialty" sauces. I ordered the garlic aioli and it was great, but the portion size sucked for the extra add on. It's mediocre, typical American food.

I came in here the other night with my husband and ordered the large Caesar salad ....  the salad tasted dirty and i found a little gooey piece of something in it. Set it aside, and tried to continue eating but the taste of the salad was off putting. Next time the server came by i asked her if she knew what it was and she said no and asked if i would like it "re tossed" i said yes.... not thinking they would take that same exact salad and re toss it. Came back a few minutes later with the same salad re tossed and i still couldn't eat it because it tasted the same. I'll take a little break from returning to this location for a while !

Thank you for my 2 pieces of broccoli for my side with my burger..... subbed broccoli instead of fries and get two pieces of broccoli. this location.... something is seriously wrong with the service and lack of care. This isn't the first time I have experienced this type of service, but I normally just let it go and not say anything until now.  Will most likely just start driving out to Beaverton..

Staff was rude when I inquired about wait time for a to-go order. Finally told me that I had just placed the order (I knew that, having just placed the order.) Then the order took much longer than the 15 minutes quoted.

I typically wouldn't give 4 stars to a burger chain, but due to the significant effort, improvement, and service, it's warranted.  I've been out of the area a little while now, have had a few not-so-great experiences at other locations, and was craving a burger so I decided to give this place another try. Due to the last few experiences My expectations were not grand, however I was pleased with the experience and my daughter also seemed satisfied.  I still strongly dislike the parking lot. Not only are the spots way too small, the lines have now faded, so it's tricky to see how to get into the spots, and the lighting seems dimmer. Even though there are multiple entrances, it's hard to get into the lot and park conveniently.  They were very busy and had a wait despite it being after 8pm, but offered immediate seating in the bar, which was also packed. We opted to wait for a table, and since we were starving, the wait fortunately took only a few minutes.  It took me longer to figure out what to order. When I'm really hungry I have a hard time deciding what to get. Especially at a place where most of the choices are pretty much the same. After all, they are all just burgers.  I finally picked a taco burger, which was really good but was a mistake since I am unable to finish an entire burger in one sitting, and guac doesn't keep. My daughter went with her usual, the teriyaki burger, which they call the bonzai. We both had substituions. She likes to add onions and change the cheese. I like to get the sweet potato fries. Everything with the meal went smoothly for the most part. There was one minor issue that was addressed immediately before we even asked so I will not complain about it.  Our server, Tyna or Tanya? Was great. Very patient, on the ball, and attentive.  She was helpful with the menu and the check was exactly right. Even though I'm not a huge RR or burger fan, and this location is quite a bit out of my way, I'd go to this location over the several that are closer to my house.

I called to reserve a table, and was told very rudely that they do not accept reservations. Came into the restaurant to put my name in for a table, and was told it would be an hour long wait. Gave the hostess Ellie my name and phone number. She told me they would text/call me 10 minutes before the table was ready. Went to go do some shopping within walking distance. After an hour and no text/call I went back to Red Robin. Ellie told me the table was given away. I asked if they called or texted me and she said yes, but there were no notifications on my phone. The manager then came over and told me that they do not call or text customers to notify them when the table is ready. So I was lied to and had to waste more of my time waiting for a table. Staff and management were very unapologetic. This negatively impacted my friends and my experience for the rest of the meal. Why would I ever come back in to pay a premium for food I can make at home and be treated with disrespect?
